content.description: While you could climb the original 1971 route it's almost a disgrace to bypass this beautiful dihedral/crack climb.  Located a few yards west of the original scramble this new line boasts wonderful rock, solid gear placements and unique movement at its top crux.  Nuts and a few smaller cams are useful to protect the crux.
content.protection: We had a double rack, nuts and single #4 and #5.  Two Ropes needed for rap.  Rappel the route off large pine.
content.location: From the base of Coconino if coming down Shoshone Point walk directly to Newtons south point on its eastern side.  The route is not visible until you hike a few yards past the start.  Allow 2.5 to 6 hours to reach if unfamiliar with Canyon approaches.

content.description: Always sunny except when cloudy, pretty dry unless its wet, solid rock until it crumbles.  A neat, triangular butte with a soon-to-be classic rock climb.
